column2: 10+ years of experience in IT Industry, preferably worked in Airline sector.     5+ years of proven capabilities in managing leadership levels in Software Quality Assurance/Testing domain.     Experience in software testing, with expertise in HIL testing of various ECUs using simulators and embedded testing will be an added advantage.     Deep knowledge of using Test Bench to validate various scenarios in the bench testing.     Good knowledge of Infotainment system and other technologies used in the Infotainment architecture.     Experience in managing Agile and Waterfall projects.     Knowledge of Automation testing and other tools technologies     KEY RESPONSIBILITIES AND DELIVERABLES:     1.Supervise the testing of software on embedded systems, including hardware and firmware, to ensure seamless integration and performance.   2.Verify compatibility and functionality of software on various embedded devices.   3.Experienced in automotive Telematics control testing and good analytics skill.   4.Mentor and coach the team on testing various components in the vehicle like Infotainment system, Connected Car applications and flow of data between various ECUs within the vehicle   5.Provide expertise in testing on simulators and emulators to replicate real-world scenarios and validate software behavior.   6.Ensure proper functionality and accuracy of canalizer tools for data capture and analysis.   7.Project Management - Planning, Execution, Monitoring and Control of the Project, Review of Test Cases, and scenarios, Planning for the team - Work Allocation   8.Stakeholder management - Interactions with customer and their partners - requirements, defects, clarifications, etc   9.Managing agile and waterfall projects.   10.Project Execution and Delivery   11.Plan Automation strategy on the project to ensure higher ROI with increase in Speed and Reusability.   12.Supporting Test Manager/ PM in Risk identification and manage

column2: Responsibilities A day in the life of an Infoscion As part of the Infosys consulting team, your primary role would be to lead the engagement effort of providing high-quality and value-adding consulting solutions to customers at different stages- from problem definition to diagnosis to solution design, development and deployment.  You will review the proposals prepared by consultants, provide guidance, and analyze the solutions defined for the client business problems to identify any potential risks and issues.  You will identify change Management requirements and propose a structured approach to client for managing the change using multiple communication mechanisms.  You will also coach and create a vision for the team, provide subject matter training for your focus areas, motivate and inspire team members through effective and timely feedback and recognition for high performance.  You would be a key contributor in unit-level and organizational initiatives with an objective of providing high-quality, value-adding consulting solutions to customers adhering to the guidelines and processes of the organization. If you think you fit right in to help our clients navigate their next in their digital transformation journey, this is the place for you! Technical and Professional Requirements: Primary skills:Domain->Media & Entertainment->DTH Services,Technology->Mobile Development Platform->Android,Technology->Mobile Testing->Mobile Automation Testing,Technology->Mobile development platform->iOS  Preferred Skills:  Domain->Cable & Media->Video Management Technology->Media->Settop Box DVB  Additional Responsibilities: Good knowledge on software configuration management systems Strong business acumen, strategy and cross-industry thought leadership Awareness of latest technologies and Industry trends Logical thinking and problem solving skills along with an ability to collaborate Two or three industry domain knowledge  Understanding of the financial processes for various types of projects and the various pricing models available Client Interfacing skills Knowledge of SDLC and agile methodologies  Project and Team management  Educational Requirements MSc,MCA,MTech,Master Of Engineering,BCA,BSc,BTech,Bachelor of Engineering  Service Line Engineering Services *  Location of posting is subject to business requirements
column11: E2E Automation, Video Management, Mobile Automation Testing, Mobile Development, Project management, agile methodologies, SDLC

column1: Hiring - Automation/RPA Solution Architect - Thryve DIgital
column2: UiPath, Automation Anywhere   Role Summary: RPA Blue Prism Solution Architect will support our engagements in designing and implementing Robotic Process Automation (RPA) solutions using the Blue Prism platform. Our ideal candidate is responsible for overall RPA workflow solution design and providing support to the creation/update of the RPA solution architecture design document. Also, conducts architectural evaluation, design and analysis of client Enterprise-wide systems and stimulate apt design discipline to leverage operation models into RPA solution design models. Essential Responsibilities The RPA Architect candidate will have extensive knowledge of Robotics Process Automation technologies and frameworks and will be responsible for designing and implementing RPA solutions to automate business processes. Collaborate with the business and IT teams to understand business processes and identify areas for automation. Design and develop RPA architecture and components, incorporating best practices and guidelines. Create technical documentation for RPA implementation, including design documents, technical specifications, and user guides. Review and approve RPA design documentation, code and software libraries. Develop and maintain relationships with RPA vendors to stay up to date on emerging RPA technologies and industry trends Manage development and deployment of RPA solutions, ensuring adherence to project timelines, budgets and quality standards. Provide input to project management and governance processes to ensure timely delivery of RPA solutions. Provide recommendations to optimize RPA solution performance. Other duties as assigned or requested. Education Required Bachelor or masters degree in computer/information and electronic system Experience Required 10+ years of experience in software design and development Minimum of 5 years of experience in developing RPA solutions preferably Blue Prism Minimum of 2 years of experience as a RPA Solution Architect Should have designed and delivered project using Blueprism in multiple technology areas like mainframe, java, .Net and ETL Experience with AI (ML, NLP, DL) and using other RPA tools like UiPath, Automation Anywhere Excellent verbal and written and communication skills Strategic thinking, strong analytical and problem-solving skills Subject matter expert of RPA process and tools Strong execution ability and a sense of urgency Collaborative and resilient Experience in process mapping, process design, and process re-engineering Proficient with scripting languages such as Python or PowerShell Experience in working with SQL databases Excellent interpersonal and communication skills Good to Have Experience in Healthcare or Health Insurance Industry  If interested in the above JD, Please send your resume to reshma.kadharhussain@thryvedigital.com
column11: Intelligent Automation, RPA solution Architect, UiPath, Blueprism, RPA, NLP, Automation Anywhere, Machine Learning, Deep Learning

column2: 8+ years of experience as a Marketo (Primary) Salesforce Marketing Cloud technical subject matter expert, with hands-on experience in solving complex business problems based on real-world experience.                                              Knowledge and hands-on experience with programming and scripting languages, web services, web development, relational databases, and integration with REST APIs. Experience with any of the following: JavaScript, ASPdot net, C# and Java                                              Deep understanding of all digital marketing and product experiences, and an understanding of how they connect brands to consumers.                                              Proven success in the design, development, and delivery of SaaS integration solutions.                                              Proficiency in developing business cases, eliciting requirements, and implementing solution strategies with non-technical individuals, development teams, and other ancillary project members for enterprise-level prospects and customers.                                                                                            Industry Specialization:                                                    Marketo, Salesforce CRM, Marketo Certified Expert certification preferred.                                              Salesforce Marketing Cloud certifications preferred.                                                                                            Key Roles and Responsibilities:                                                    Creates marketing automation implementation plans to include sales and marketing alignment, lead-to-revenue strategies, database requirements, automation configuration, and functional mapping of integrations                                              Leads architecture projects, working to understand functional requirements, and interacting with cross-functional teams to architect, design, develop, test, and deliver                                              Help to set up the integrations between Marketo, SF and CRM systems (Salesforce.com, Microsoft Dynamics CRM, NetSuite, Oracle, HubSpot)                                              Rich experience in lead nurturing, lead scoring and sales/marketing organization alignment principles.                                              An ability to conduct detailed training sessions in Marketo and Salesforce Marketing Cloud                                                                                                                                    Skills critical to be successful in the role:                                                   As Top level technical expert should able to support multiple end user groups. Work with user groups to identify and solve business problems with the breadth and depth of experience with all available technology including hardware, software and databases.                                              Requires broad and deep technical experience related to studying and analyzing systems needs, systems development, systems process analysis, design, and re-engineering.                                              The Specialist level will have highly developed skills and experience in business management, systems engineering, operations research, and management engineering.                                              Typically requires specialization in multiple software or business applications utilized in an end user environment.                                              Keeps abreast of technological developments and applications and uses that information to proactively initiate enhancements to mitigate against future problems.                                              Will often coach or mentor less senior support professionals.                                              Should able to Serve as the highest level technical support to multiple end users.

column2: IDESLABS PRIVATE LIMITED is looking for Automation Architect to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      Process Analysis and Assessment:Automation architects analyze existing processes and workflows to identify areas that can benefit from automation      They assess the feasibility and potential impact of automation on efficiency and resource utilization      Solution Design:They design automation solutions and frameworks tailored to the specific needs of the organization      This involves selecting appropriate technologies, defining automation workflows, and outlining integration points      Tool and Technology Selection:Automation architects evaluate and select automation tools, software platforms, scripting languages, and other technologies that best align with the organization's goals and requirements      Development and Implementation:They lead or collaborate with development teams to create and implement automation scripts, workflows, and applications      This may involve coding, scripting, and integrating various systems      Continuous Improvement:Automation architects continuously monitor and refine automation processes to ensure they remain effective and aligned with changing business needs      They identify areas for optimization and enhancement      Integration:Automation architects ensure that automated solutions seamlessly integrate with existing systems, applications, and databases      They may work on integrating APIs, connectors, and data sources      Testing and Quality Assurance:They design testing strategies and perform quality assurance to ensure that automated processes are reliable, accurate, and error-free
column11: Solution design, Architect, Automation, Resource utilization, Process analysis, Manager Quality Assurance, Coding, Automation tools, Continuous improvement, Scripting

column2: Ericsson is seeking a highly skilled Automation Architect specializing in Robotic Process Automation (RPA) with expertise in UiPath technology. As an Automation Architect, you will play a pivotal role in crafting, implementing, and optimizing automation solutions to streamline business processes, improve operational efficiency, and drive digital transformation initiatives within the organization.                What you will do                  Collaborate with stakeholders to identify automation opportunities across various business functions and processes.             Lead the end-to-end design and architecture of RPA solutions using UiPath platform.             Develop automation strategies and roadmaps aligned with business objectives and requirements.             Conduct feasibility assessments and provide recommendations on the suitability of automation for identified processes.             Design and implement scalable, reliable, and maintainable RPA solutions that adhere to best practices and industry standards.             Work closely with development teams to integrate RPA solutions with existing systems and applications.             Define governance models, standards, and policies for RPA implementation and maintenance.             Provide technical guidance and mentorship to RPA developers and project teams.             Conduct performance monitoring, optimization, and fixing of deployed automation solutions.             Stay updated with the latest advancements in RPA technologies, tools, and methodologies.                 You will bring                  Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field. Masters degree preferred.             Validated experience of 8-14 years in crafting and implementing RPA solutions, with a focus on UiPath technology.             Strong understanding of RPA concepts, principles, and methodologies.             Hands-on experience with UiPath Studio, Orchestrator, and other related tools.             Proficiency in programming languages such as C#, VB.NET, or Python.             Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.             Ability to communicate optimally with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.             Experience in leading cross-functional teams and handling multiple projects simultaneously.             Relevant certifications in RPA (eg, UiPath Certified RPA Associate/Professional) would be helpful.             Prior experience in telecommunications or related industries is a plus.
column11: Automation, VB.NET, Analytical, Manager Technology, Programming, Information technology, Performance monitoring, associate professional, Python

column2: This position is needed to form a automation team by training the team members on UiPath automation and take up the automation related activities in all the systems ERP team supports        Responsibilities          Lead the automation team, maintaining close collaboration with key stakeholders, including the Business Team, Product Owners, System Architects, IT Team, etc      Support the formation of a Center of Excellence (COE) team and outline the governance structure for automation initiatives.      Develop a strategy for creating reusable components in UiPath RPA automations.      Collect automation requirements from diverse teams, prioritize them, design solutions, and guide developers in their implementations.      Provide training to the team on UiPath Cloud RPA Automations.      Lead all sprint events including Sprint planning to plan the deliverables for upcoming sprints, sprint demos to showcase completed automation solutions.      Provide Proof of concepts in any relevant new feature on UiPath Automations.      Proactive participation in Enterprise level automation events like kick start, office hours, collaboration, Hackathon, etc          Qualifications              Required:          Minimum 7 years of experience in UiPath Automations with at least 3 years as a lead in UiPath Automation projects and 4 to 5 years of experience in UIPath.      Design and development (Hands-on) experience in UiPath Automations      Relevant experience in UiPath Automation Cloud including Orchestrator, Automation hub, Studio, StudioX, Task Capture, Task Mining, etc      Experience in facilitating the Center of Excellence (COE) team.      Atleast 3 End to End implementation automation projects experience including requirement gathering, design, development, deployment and execution      Should have basic understanding and knowledge in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning      Good Communication and interpersonal skills      This role will be working in EMEA shift (1 PM to 10 PM IST or 2 PM to 11 PM IST)          Desired:              Relevant experience in CPaaS industries or Financial domains

column2: Drive change: Be part of a transformative movement shaping the future of software.              Lead together: Our Nordic leadership style emphasizes transparency, mutual support, and leading by example. We believe in both guiding and being guided.              Growth potential: Leapwork offers substantial growth opportunities within the organization. If youre ready to learn and lead, your journey begins here.              Respectfully different: Our team thrives on respect and inclusivity. We embrace differences, nurturing a supportive culture that values each individuals uniqueness.                      Role Responsibilities:                    Understand customers requirements and purpose the best possible automation solutions to our customers      .                  Perform test automation requirement analysis, test strategy design, automation estimation, and planning prioritization, execution, automation monitoring, and control.                  Collaborate with different teams to assure architectural solutions could be suitably translated into effectual and robust implementation.                  Reviewing customers automated test scripts, providing guidance to customers in implementing best practices, and fixing design/script issues                  Design and develop proofs-of-concept, demo to customers, and      provide      the architectural guidance to the end customers      .                  Assist      pre-sales and sales in their client conversations      in order to      ensure maximum conversions and high-quality dialogue.                  Provide test automation effort estimation to our sales team and create customer implementation plans based on customer prioritization      .                      Assist      customer success team to ensure product value creation by technically involved with assigned customers throughout their customer life cycle      .                  Help customers in onboarding, adoption, and scaling, and getting success with the product      .                  Troubleshoot complex automation issues with customers and resolve them under agreed SLA      .                  Create a knowledge base, training materials, and provide community support to leads and customers      .                  Ensure that customer feedback is incorporated in Leapwork      .                  Engage with clients in both technical pre-and post-sales activities to ensure LEAPWORK adoption, here are the type of engagements      .                        Implementation            (      Remote, when possible and      On-Site      , when not) - these are short/long term implementations you need to get involved time to time may be a few projects at a time remotely                    Tech Advisory Services            - Short term implementation support      assistance      calls in which we      provide      our view on necessary How-To questions                    Health Checks            - Should be formed as a checklist to be      analysed      and filled in, should cover the areas of test (definitions, docs),      flow(      Top Level design review), Infrastructure, Maintainability (a maintainability qualifier should be      defined) and the result will be presented as a professional document detailing      current status      and recommendations. Most probably an on-site activity.                    Flow Reviews            - this is a detailed flow review as a service aiming to check Best Practices compliance and coverage      .                        Workshops            - Roadmap presentations, Best Practices presentations, presentation in user groups, expo                    Upgrade      Readiness            -      Analysis of an existing system to prepare a LEAPWORK upgrade                    Technical Qualifications/ Role Requirements (Must - Have Skills)                    Minimum      8      + years of proven, relevant Automation Experience.                  Understanding of Enterprise Architecture and IT systems and value-based selling.                  Working Knowledge on Automation Frameworks, test automation strategy, automation effort estimation, and test automation prioritization.                  Excellent Leadership and convincing skills, ability to lead a small team from time to time.                  Working Knowledge of automation tools such as Selenium Web Driver/VSTS/UFT/Any RPA tools etc.                  Knowledge of at least one programming knowledge like C#/Java/Python.                  Should      possess      good presentation and excellent communication skills.                  Be experienced with agile, DevOps processes, source control, database, and CI/CD implementation.                  Having knowledge of tools such as Jira, Jenkins, Team City, Azure, etc. is a plus.                  Enjoy working in a fast-paced, global environment      .                  Bachelors degree in Engineering      or equivalent preferred.

column2: Role & responsibilities:   Mandatory Skills needed: Front-End (Presentation Layer):  Understanding of UI/UX principles and the ability to automate interactions with web applications. Back-End (Data Layer):  Knowledge of RDBMS and NoSQL (MongoDB must) databases, APIs, and data manipulation techniques for automating data flows. Application Layer:  Expertise in scripting languages and frameworks to automate application functionalities. Integrate cross-functional applications including RPA bots and ML models scripted in languages such as Python or R. Infrastructure Layer:  Familiarity with infrastructure provisioning, configuration management tools, and cloud platforms for automating infrastructure deployments.   Broader Skills needed: Cloud Solutioning:  Deep understanding of cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) for infrastructure provisioning, deployment automation, and serverless computing to leverage the scalability and elasticity of the cloud for automation tasks. Robotic Process Automation (RPA):  Expertise in RPA tools and techniques to automate repetitive, rule-based tasks, often involving user interface interactions, data manipulation, and legacy system integrations. Machine Learning (ML) and Natural Language Processing (NLP):  Knowledge of ML algorithms and NLP techniques to build intelligent automation solutions. This could involve tasks like anomaly detection in log data, sentiment analysis for customer feedback automation, or chatbots powered by NLP. Security & Monitoring:  Implementing robust security measures to ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of automated processes. Designing monitoring frameworks to track the performance and health of automation solutions.   Strategy and Implementation skills needed. Business Process Analysis:  Analyzing business processes to find automation opportunities, considering cost-effectiveness, feasibility, and potential impact on workflows. Solution Design and Development:  Designing and developing automation solutions that leverage a combination of traditional app development, RPA tools, ML algorithms, and cloud-based services. Integration and Orchestration:  Integrating various automation tools and platforms (RPA, cloud services, ML models) to create a unified workflow, ensuring seamless data flow and communication between different components. Standardization and Governance:  Establishing best practices, coding standards, and governance frameworks for automation development and deployment within the organization. Communication and Collaboration:  Collaborating effectively with various stakeholders across the organization, e.g., Business Analysts, Developers, Data Scientists/ML Engineers, IT Operations Teams etc.  Technical Expertise: In-depth knowledge of scripting languages like Python, Java, PowerShell, and Bash for automating various tasks across different IT layers (front-end, back-end, application, infrastructure). Solid understanding of cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) for infrastructure provisioning, deployment automation, and serverless computing. Experience with RPA tools (UiPath, Automation Anywhere) to automate rule-based processes involving UI interactions, data manipulation, and legacy system integrations. Familiarity with Machine Learning (ML) concepts and algorithms for building intelligent automation solutions (e.g., anomaly detection, sentiment analysis). Working knowledge of Natural Language Processing (NLP) to automate tasks involving text processing, chatbots, or language translation (if applicable). Experience with CI/CD pipelines (Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery) for automating the software development and deployment process. Understanding of security best practices to ensure the integrity and reliability of automated processes. Additional Qualification Criteria: 15+ years of experience in IT automation, with at least 05 years in a lead or architect role. A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field   Certifications in relevant technologies (cloud platforms, RPA tools) can be advantageous. Understanding of the specific automation challenges and best practices prevalent in the Indian IT industry can be a plus. Experience working in an agile development environment might be beneficial. Excellent written and spoken English communication skills are essential.

column2: A Test Architect is a senior-level professional responsible for designing and implementing the testing strategy and framework for software projects     The Test Architect collaborates with cross-functional teams, including developers, quality assurance engineers, product managers, and project managers, to ensure the quality and reliability of software applications     They define testing processes, methodologies, and tools to improve testing efficiency and effectiveness across the software development lifecycle     Responsibilities:Test Strategy Development: Define the overall testing approach, methodologies, and best practices to ensure comprehensive test coverage for software applications     Test Planning: Collaborate with project stakeholders to develop test plans, including test objectives, scope, timelines, and resource requirements     Test Framework Design: Design and implement scalable and maintainable test frameworks that support automated and manual testing efforts     Automation Strategy: Assess opportunities for test automation and create a strategy to maximize test automation coverage, reduce testing cycles, and improve regression testing     Tool Selection and Integration: Evaluate and select appropriate testing tools and technologies to support the testing process     Integrate testing tools with the development and continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines     Test Data Management: Define strategies for test data creation, management, and anonymization to support various test scenarios     Performance Testing: Develop performance testing strategies and coordinate performance testing activities to identify and address performance bottlenecks     Security Testing: Collaborate with security experts to ensure that security testing is integrated into the testing process to identify and address vulnerabilities
column11: Automation, Web technologies, Selenium, Budgeting, Test Architect

column2: Responsible for defining and communicating a shared technical and architectural vision for Product Teams to help ensure the system or Solution under development is fit for its intended purpose. Embrace a leadership role - contribute to the Vision and Roadmap in order to chart a course for the Solution; Contribute to Value Stream Mapping workshops and train/coach engineers in achieving Technical Agility Define, explore, and support the implementation of Enablers to evolve solution intent, working directly with Product teams to implement them; Work with customers and suppliers to help ensure fitness for purpose. Enable the Continuous Delivery Pipeline and DevOps - advocate for and steer the development and improvement of the Continuous Delivery Pipeline, as well as help architects to enable Release on Demand. Plan and develop the Architectural Roadmap/Plan in support of new business Features and Capabilities; Participate in planning, definition, and high-level design of the solution and explore solution alternatives. Work with Product and Solution Management to determine the capacity allocation for enablement work; Participate in Planning and Pre- and Post-PI Planning, System and Solution Demos, and Inspect and Adapt events. Work with customers, stakeholders, and suppliers to establish high-level Solution Intent, and the solution intent information models and documentation requirements. Establish critical NFRs (Nonfunctional Requirements) at the solution level, participate in the definition of others; Provide oversight and input to high-level and detail design of infrastructure, interfaces, extensions, and workflows while meeting architecture, security, performance, scalability, and maintainability requirements. Provide oversight and foster Built-In Quality and Team and Technical Agility; Adopt new mindsets and habits in how people approach their work while supporting decentralized decision making. Creates and manages life cycle of technical specifications from which programs and configurations will be applied to create the application, infrastructure, or complete solution. Proactively seeks opportunities to enhance efficiency in the build and deploy processes, promote reusability of component designs to reduce costs and shorten time to deliver solutions by leveraging automation where possible. Ensures completion of installation, configuration, upgrades, and migration of software, systems and servers across development, staging, and production environments in on-premises, virtual, remotely hosted, and cloud environments. Skills Agile Architecture - Designs the fundamental organization of a system embodied by its components, their relationships to each other and to the environment to guide its emergent design and evolution. Agile Systems Thinking - Embraces a holistic approach to analysis that focuses on the way that a system's constituent parts interrelate and how systems work over time and within the context of larger systems to ensure the economic success of the solution. Business Architecture Design - Defines and creates business capability maps using standards, templates, tools and methodologies to provide a common understanding of key capabilities aligned to strategic objectives and tactical demands. Business insight - Applying knowledge of business and the marketplace to advance the organization??s goals. Communicates effectively - Developing and delivering multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences. Continuous Delivery Pipeline - Implements the workflows, activities, and automation by providing the enterprise with the capability to shepherd a new piece of functionality all the way from ideation to an on-demand release of value to the end user. Global perspective - Taking a broad view when approaching issues, using a global lens. Lean Agile and SAFe Mindset - Advocates for and leads others in the concepts of the Agile Manifesto and Lean thinking in support of adopting and applying the 9 SAFe principles and practices for the organization. Manages conflict - Handling conflict situations effectively, with a minimum of noise. Regulatory Risk Compliance Management - Evaluates the design and effectiveness of controls against established industry frameworks and regulations to assess adherence with legal/regulatory requirements. Release Planning - Plans and manages the release of capabilities, features or products using inputs from the prioritized roadmap, planning, available resources and skills to communicate expected availability and releases of capability. System Solution Architecture - Creates solution designs and patterns using the Cummins Technical Reference Model (CTRM), CLEAN standards, and existing reference patterns to maintain alignment to Cummins standards. Education, Licenses, Certifications College, university, or equivalent degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business, or related subject, or relevant equivalent experience required. Google, AWS, Azure, Oracle, Docker, Kubernetes, Puppet, CompTIA, and other Cloud Development Certifications are preferred. Cloud architecture certifications, or Cloud Development certifications are preferred. This position may require licensing for compliance with export controls or sanctions regulations. Experience 9 years of relevant work experience required. Experience in Systems Engineering, including supervisory experience, utilizing a broad knowledge base in fundamental IT skills and modern development and deployment practices, DevSecOps tooling, and infrastructure as code (IaC) preferred. Hands on experience as an Enterprise IT Architect preferred. Broad business knowledge required. Experience Total experience of 12 years with relevant experience of 9 years. Expertise in Robotic Process Automation (RPA) administration, encompassing the configuration, maintenance, and optimization of RPA tools and environments. Defines and implements the RPA & Automation architectural roadmap working with RPA/Automation team, Enterprise Architect teams, business teams to support future business capabilities. Architects, Designs, Implements, and maintains continuous build and deployment delivery mechanisms, leveraging innovative solutions and automation Demonstrates proven capability to proactively assess RPA performance, scalability and has ability to evaluates the impact and feasibility of the system changes, and proposes the best solutions to implement them. Hands on experience with RPA Solution design and development is required. Proficient in network provisioning and administration of load balancers, firewalls, etc. and implement security standards, efficient disaster recovery plan Experience in architecting Cloud first, API first, DevOps and Agile automation Has keen eye in NFRs and Critically assess the uptimes and performance of bots and servers. Brings a breakthrough solution in system availability and performance of the systems. Demonstrates capabilities of RPA/Automation system upgrade practices and executions Technical Skills Experience in RPA platforms like UiPath (preferred) /Automation Anywhere. TOGAF certification is added advantage. Understanding of virtualization technologies (e.g., VMware, Hyper-V, citrix) and different operating systems Experience in any cloud orchestration (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) Knowledge of database systems (e.g., SQL Server, Oracle) for managing data used in automation processes. Scripting skills (e.g., PowerShell, Python) for automation and integration tasks. Familiarity with programming languages (e.g., C#, Java, .net) as some RPA tools support custom coding. Experience in integrating RPA tools with other systems and applications using APIs or connectors. Understanding of RESTful and SOAP web services. Awareness of AI and machine learning concepts, especially if dealing with Intelligent Automation or cognitive automation features. Practical ITSM knowledge

column2: As a technology lead, you will be focused on building end to end automation process solutions that meets business requirements.                  You will work within project planning constraints, owning development solutions and have a high level of exposure to a wide range of stakeholders at all levels of the business.                 The technology lead, with general direction will be responsible for the proper assessment, requirements gathering, design, development, testing, delivery, and ongoing support of automated solutions using UiPath & Power Platform (Power Automate & PowerApps).                  The technology lead is expected to assist in the advancement of a continuously improving automation life cycle framework and deliver automated processes in scope as aligned with the customer.                  This role requires the ability to understand complex business requirements and use appropriate methodologies in alignment with the prescribed RPA technologies to meet the strategic objectives of the business.                       Key Accountabilities                        Experience in enterprise level large scale RPA development & implementation using UiPath & Power Platform (Power Automate & PowerApps)                  Defines and plans the development approach for larger projects through to smaller developments factoring in the existing RPA program and future development opportunities into the solution design.                  Design and develop RPA process solutions in accordance with standard UiPath & Power Platform design principles and conventions and development best practice.                 Work within project planning constraints, communicating any identified project risks and issues accordingly.                 Create and maintain solution documentation                  Support business teams in testing activities, including integration testing, end-to-end (business process) testing and UAT                 Problem solve issues that arise in day-to-day running of automation processes and through potential process redesign                 Lead the investigation and detailed analysis of RPA Incidents and process exceptions including a strategic approach to root cause analysis.                       Qualification                       UiPath & Power Platform (Power Automate & PowerApps) Developer Accreditation.                 Bachelor degree in computer science or engineering.                       Experience                        Experience in end to end implementation of minimum 3 processes using UiPath & Power Platform (Power Automate & PowerApps).                 Minimum 4 years of coding experience in any of languages (eg: .net, VBA, SQL, HTML, C#).                 Excellent working knowledge of Microsoft Office packages including Word, PowerPoint, Visio and Excel.                       Essential Skill Set                       An aptitude for problem solving, with the ability to take a logical route to the source of an error.                  Fully conversant with computing concepts and RPA development lifecycle methodologies.                 Ability to prioritize, schedule and complete tasks required for multiple projects with overlapping schedules                 Excellent understanding of workflow based logic and the ability to both understand a business process from a workflow diagram or a business requirements document and to conceptualize it as an automated solution.                 Excellent motivation skills, being both self-motivated & self-directed with ability to deliver outcomes to strict deadlines and able to motivate others at all levels.                  Highly motivated and resilient and able to adapt to change.                  Knows how to prioritize requests effectively and efficiently and work with a sense of urgency                 Detail oriented and thorough                 Excellent time management skills                 Proactive, persistent and dependable

column2: Solution Design: Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business processes, requirements, and pain points, and identify opportunities for automation using Power Automate. Design end-to-end automation solutions leveraging Power Automate, including workflow automation, business process automation, and integration with other systems and services. Develop technical architecture, workflow diagrams, and solution documentation to guide the implementation of Power Automate solutions. Development and Implementation: Configure and develop Power Automate flows, connectors, and custom actions to automate business processes and tasks effectively. Integrate Power Automate with Microsoft 365 applications, Azure services, on-premises systems, and third-party applications using connectors and APIs. Implement best practices for Power Automate development, including error handling, exception management, and performance optimization. Governance and Security: Define and enforce governance policies, standards, and guidelines for Power Automate usage within the organization, ensuring compliance with security and regulatory requirements. Implement role-based access controls (RBAC), data loss prevention (DLP), and other security measures to protect sensitive information and ensure data privacy. Monitor and analyze Power Automate usage, performance, and security metrics, and take proactive measures to mitigate risks and optimize efficiency. Training and Knowledge Sharing: Provide training, coaching, and support to users, developers, and administrators on Power Automate capabilities, best practices, and troubleshooting techniques. Conduct workshops, seminars, and knowledge sharing sessions to promote awareness and adoption of Power Automate across the organization. Foster a culture of continuous learning and innovation, encouraging collaboration and exchange of ideas among team members. Continuous Improvement: Stay updated on the latest developments, features, and enhancements in Power Automate and related Microsoft technologies. Evaluate emerging trends, tools, and methodologies in process automation and recommend opportunities for improvement and innovation. Solicit feedback from stakeholders, gather user requirements, and iteratively enhance Power Automate solutions to meet evolving business needs. Location: Bengaluru,Hyderabad,Pune,Indore
